parameters: I've never seen a closet with an outlet in it.
It's like a cavern in there.
I can tell my phone screen's not going to cut it.
I’ve definitely seen a flashlight somewhere. Where was it?
I need a flashlight. There was one somewhere else in the house.
I've never seen a closet with an outlet in it.
I haven't checked all the walls yet.
The flashlight definitely wasn't in the bathroom.
Yeah. No. Not going in there right now.
There's an abalone shell, a conch shell, and a morpho butterfly in the case.
No cable ports in the shelves. Not that I would expect there to be.
The bookcase is a little ajar.
And it's like there's light seeping out from behind it.
\>I. I. I didn’t plan on you coming here when you did.
I was going to take\.—take\. this down\.\. before you f\.f\.found it.
But I was\. nervous you’d catch me.\. Because the latch is loud.\.\. So I couldn't.
I didn't\.\. mean\. for you to\. see it.
So you’ve been following me. Tracking my movements. Photographing me.
Stealing my jacket and lying to my face about it. \|That might bother me the most.
Then luring me back here after I told you something really personal.
Lee, I’ll be honest with you.
It is really disturbing that you’ve been able to act like everything is normal.
Like, I know I’m dense. I know I'm not as aware of my surroundings as I should be.
But I just chalked your nerves up to... I don’t know, believing you actually liked me as a person.
I—\|I do.\| I do like you.\| I do.\| I do\.\^
This is not how you treat a person you like.
When you like somebody, you treat them with respect.
Why does this keep happening to me?
There must be something really wrong with me to attract someone like you.
\|I liked you. I made that obvious.
“Well, you're stupid for going somewhere alone with a guy again.”
“I mean, you’re kind of asking for something bad to happen.”
That's what you've been thinking. Right?
"It’s my fault if people take advantage of me when I give them a chance."
I need more love and understanding in my life than that.
I don’t deserve to be treated like this for trusting people.
Hold on. Let me drive you.
There’s no bus stop for miles.
Just give me\| thirty minutes. And then I’ll drive you home.
Stay right here. Don't go anywhere.
Calm down. I just want my jacket back.
I just want it back now.
I\. am\. going\. to\. wash\. it\. and\. then\. you\. can\. have\. it\.\.\^
\.\.I just want to get out of here.
I'm gonna keep looking for the router.
I don't know where he went. I should hurry.
I sort of wrote it off earlier, but maybe the closet is worth checking after all.
I mean, you moved out to the middle of nowhere by yourself.
I haven’t heard you mention any friends.
Things get weird when you isolate yourself that much. \|I would know.
\|Sometimes you talk like your life is as good as over.
But if YOUR life is over, where does that leave me?
A broke dropout loser making minimum wage with no skills, no prospects, nothing.
How I am supposed to live with myself?
It’s like you’re trying to convince yourself you’re a creep.
But... \|I don't know. It feels like you just want to know me.
But I feel desperate sometimes, too. I really do.
I just keep it in my brain... or I draw it. That's how I get it out of me.
This is an outlet of sorts, too.
I mean, the doll? Come on.
...You know those dolls. The ones you stick with pins to hurt the person they look like.
As kids, my sister and I made dolls of each other like that, but to be nice to them.
When we were too afraid to leave our rooms, I would treat hers kindly. I imagined her doing the same.
\.\.It was a great comfort to me.
So I made you one after you told me what happened to you.
There’s no real effect, obviously. But it felt real as a kid.
The schedule says, “Works 2nd and 4th Sundays, 1st and 3rd Saturdays.” Even I didn’t know that.
Nobody’s ever taken this much interest in me in my entire life.
Which is why I’m worried you’re expecting way more from me than I have to offer.
I’m really not worth obsessing over. Like, at all.
Your company is more than I ever expected.
You don’t need to worry about expectations. I already know how I feel.
I have looked at the facts. I have gathered the evidence. And I have decided.
I—\|I like you. I really like you.
I look at you, and I feel like there’s actually a future.
I’ve never felt like that before.
I want to take care of you.
I want to keep you safe.
I think I can do it.
You come on really strong, really fast, Lee.
But if you can just\.\.\. calm down a little, I think this could still work.
Whatever it takes. I will do it.
Okay. Well, that is not calming down.
\|But I think your heart is in the right place.
I like you too. At least, most of what I’ve seen so far.
I've enjoyed hanging out with you. You've been nice to me.
If you just treat me like a normal person from hereon out, this doesn't have to be a dealbreaker.
You really are like an angel.
What’s wrong? You still seem worried.
This has just turned out so much better than I thought it would.
I have to think this through.
Of course they will be. Sheesh.
\|I\| got a little bit sweaty.\.\. Could I\| take a shower?
Yeah. You do that. It might help you relax a little, too.
Can you stay here? Don't go anywhere.
All right. On one condition, though.
Calm down. I just want my jacket back.
Nah, it’s fine. I barely washed it myself.
I’ve missed it. I wanna put it on.
I\. am\. going\. to\. wash\. it\. and\. then\. you\. can\. have\. it\.\.\^
\|Well, I made my decision. I don't regret it.
But it would be stupid for me to not have a plan B in case I need it.
So I’m going to keep looking for the router.
He’s in the shower. I should hurry.
I sort of wrote it off earlier, but maybe the closet is worth checking after all.
It's hard to believe this is real.
There is actually a port-shaped hole in the wall back here.
I do see a cable in there.
Let's see which way it runs.
It kinda sounded like\.\. something\.\. unlatched.
I hit the switch, and there was a noise.
There's a geode and some other pretty rocks in this display case.
No cable ports in the shelves. Not that I would expect there to be.
I'm not sure. I would guess 8:00.
I could get up and find out.
Do you not keep your phone on you?
I feel like I haven’t seen you check it once.
It’s in my coat. It's just a little work-issued flip phone.
Oh. So just texts and calls?
You can play Snake on it.
Hey now. That was VERY innovative at the turn of the century.
When they switched from pagers to phones in the psych ward where I did my hours, it was a big deal.
No. I'm just really cold, and you're really warm.
You can sleep longer, if you like.
No, I think I'll get up.
I’m terribly ill today. I couldn't possibly go in.
I have plenty of sick time accumulated. I put in notice on Friday that I’d be out.
They can bring in locums staff to cover me.
\.\.Although they never care for the aquarium properly no matter how detailed my instructions are.
Lee...\| you really don’t have to take time off just to keep me company.
It’s probably about time for me to be getting back to reality, anyway.
You know, going back to my apartment. Going back to work.
If I even have a job to go back to.
No-calling-no-showing for three days...\.\. or four days?
Well, I guess I’ll find out if they fired me.
If they did, I’ll have to start looking for something new.
You seem to be taking that idea rather well.
I mean, what choice do I have?
I kinda dug my own grave at this point.
But I’ve been having a good time with you. It was nice to get away and forget about everything.
Why not stay a few more days? It's no trouble.
Thanks, but I miss my stuff. I miss having internet.
I don’t miss my roommates, but I miss my roommates’ cats.
We can pick up your stuff.
...What was that? You mumbled a little.
Can you stay a little while longer? Just a few more hours.
\|Sure, I guess. Whenever's convenient for you.
There's some\. truck maintenance\. I neglected to do this weekend. I’d rather do that while there’s daylight.
I wanna check the time on my phone and see if I have any bars yet.
This is a nice desk. I wish I had some supplies with me.
There's a regular outlet behind the desk, but that's not what I'm looking for.
There's a regular outlet behind the desk, but that's not what I'm looking for.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
The shutters wouldn't have cable ports.
I do see a regular outlet for the lamps on the back wall, though.
There's a regular outlet behind the desk, but that's not what I'm looking for.
None of the wall that I can see right now has any ports. I should check the less visible spots.
Okay. I don't see any ports on the walls in plain sight. Let's look behind stuff.
